taglib.info: Tag library for the MMBase Community Module (communityprc), based on MMCI(MMBase Cloud Interface).

tag.name: tree
tag.info: The tree tag provides a syntax to list messages in a channel or a thread, providing means to easily build a tree-like structure.

attribute.name: thread
attribute.info: Node number, or node alias. This attribute defines the parent of the message list.

attribute.name: fields
attribute.info: Comma-separated list of fields that should be made available in the page. The fields are selected from the returned message nodes. In addition to all (real and virtual) fields of the message node, a number of additional fields can be asked. These are listtail, listhead, depth, and replycount. Note that a message node's virtual fields and formatting fucntions need not be given and can be used normally provided the base fields are included.

examplevalue.info: Fields needed for a forum. Default.

attribute.name: orderby
attribute.info: The fields on which the result set must be sorted.

attribute.name: directions
attribute.info: The direction of sorting.

attribute.name: maxdepth
attribute.info: The maximum depth of the tree to return.

attribute.name: max
attribute.info: The maximum number of results.

attribute.name: offset
attribute.info: The start index.

attribute.name: startafternode
attribute.info: The number of the node after which the lists starts.

attribute.name: startaftersequence
attribute.info: The sequence number of the node after which the lists starts.

attribute.name: opentag
attribute.info: The tagname to use for the opening tags when creating the content of listhead and listtail.

examplevalue.info: Replies of a message start a new (nested) unordered list. Default
Replies of a message are nested in blockquotes

attribute.name: closetag
attribute.info: The tagname to use for the ending tags when creating the content of listhead and listtail.

examplevalue.info: Replies of a message start a new (nested) unordered list. Default
replies of a message are nested in blockquotes

tag.name: getinfo
tag.info: The getinfo tag provides a syntax to retrieve data from the multipurpose info field from a message object.

attribute.name: node
attribute.info: The 'id' of the node or list from which this field must be taken. By default this is the node or list which is enclosing this field.

attribute.name: key
attribute.info: The key of the attribute to retrieve.

attribute.name: jspvar
attribute.info: The name of a jsp variable which will contain the reqiested value. If not provided, the value will be printed to the page at the start of the body of the tag. The variable is only available within the tag's body.

tag.name: setinfo
tag.info: The setinfo tag provides a syntax to store data in the multipurpose info field from a message object. The new value is formed by the content of the tag's body.

attribute.name: node
attribute.info: The 'id' of the node or list from which this field must be taken. By default this is the node or list which is enclosing this field.

attribute.name: key
attribute.info: The key of the attribute to set.

tag.name: post
tag.info: The post tag provides a syntax to post messages. The post attributes are stored in mm:setfield tags in the tag's body.

attribute.name: jspvar
attribute.info: The name of a jsp variable which will contain the numbe rof the enwly posted message. The variable is accessible from the endtag of the tag and onward. Only applies to forums.

tag.example: <mmcommunity:post> <mm:setfield name="channel">178</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="subject">Welcome to this message board</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="user">15</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="username">admin</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="body">Here follow the rules of this board...</mm:setfield> </mmcommunity:post>

tag.name: update
tag.info: The update tag provides a syntax to change old messages. The post attributes are stored in mm:setfield tags in the tag's body.

attribute.name: message
attribute.info: Node number, or node alias. This attribute defines the message to change.

tag.example: <mmcommunity:update message="323"> <mm:setfield name="subject">moderated</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="user">15</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="username">admin</mm:setfield> <mm:setfield name="body">This message has been moderated.</mm:setfield> </mmcommunity:update>

tag.name: delete
tag.info: A tag which removes threads. It behaves much like a node tag (for the message), but deletes the message and all its' descendends at the end of the tag.

attribute.name: message
attribute.info: The nodenumber or alias identifying the message node in MMBase.

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: With the 'id' attribute you define an unique identifier for this node. At the same time this defines an jsp 'Node' variable with this name.

attribute.name: jspvar
attribute.info: Create a JSP variable with this in the body. If you have defined 'fields' too, then these fields will have jsp-variables prefixed with jspvar and an underscore.

attribute.name: fields
attribute.info: The fields you want to have from this node. Other fields are available as well, but will only be accessible with the field-tag. Field indicated in this 'fields' attribute will also get a jsp-variable.

tag.name: deleteall
tag.info: A tag which removes all threads for a channel. It behaves much like a node tag (for the channel), but deletes all it's threads and all its' descendends at the end of the tag.

tag.name: channel

attribute.name: referid

attribute.name: action
